sentences.en: At last, the augury came ture unexpectedly.
sentences.cn: 最后, 这句谶语居然应验了.

sentences.en: Augury . Learn if an intended action will be good or bad.
sentences.cn: 卜筮:得知动作结果是好是坏.

sentences.en: It is also perhaps a favourable augury for the next chapter in the province's history.
sentences.cn: 它或许也预示着北爱下一章的历史会是平顺的.

sentences.en: It is surprising that an augur can see an augury without smiling.
sentences.cn: 出乎意外,占卜家能知预兆而不笑.

sentences.en: Still others believe it is a superstitious book augury.
sentences.cn: 许多人认为《周易》一部占卜的书,算命有关,涉嫌“迷信”.

sentences.en: The auguries of death are fast gathering around his head.
sentences.cn: 死亡的凶兆迅速展现在他的脑海中。

sentences.en: The emperor blindly worshipped divination by augury and mystical intepretation of Confucianist texts.
sentences.cn: 这位皇帝非常迷信谶纬之言.

sentences.en: The maritime passage was a good augury for the aerial passage.
sentences.cn: 顺利的航海仿佛也是航空的好预兆.

trans.tran_cn: （古罗马）占卜术，占卜仪式，预兆
trans.tran_en: An augury is a sign of what will happen in the future
